text: here is the full project. srcDir is pointing to src
Your `hsproject.json` should be one level higher, outside the `src/` directory

Thanks for the answer!
I did run into the issue you mentioned, but that happened when I got my fieldpath wrong. It worked OK in the end, though it seems not all the fontawesome icons are available through the picker + they are a bit harder to style.
It is. I used the CLI to create the project
Ah gotcha, and your `srcDir` in this case should just be `"."` rather than `"src"`
So i just went with <i className=“fontwaesome here”> since the users are tech savvy enough to find the FA codes they want.

Same issue, its like its not detecting the module. Its not building like it does with a CRM project i.e. <https://github.com/HubSpot/ui-extensions-examples/tree/main/duplicate-contact|This one>

```[ERROR] The post in account 275827 was bad. Failed to queue the build because project `Sprocket Rocket` failed validation. Make sure there are no duplicate component names and contact support if the problem persists.
- No components were found when analyzing your project. Add components to your project and re-upload.```
So now in your src/ folder you need a `cms-assets.json` file
that will make your `src` folder be recognized as a React project component

Is this possible? Basically I just want to to useEffect or custom change listeners to the Form Fields.

In NextJS server and client components, we would just basically wrap the server component with the client component, that pattern is what I want to achieve.
